chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • John A. Worden was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine.

timeConds.notes: Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber. Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John A. Worden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
15CM6 & 15CM8 Cases called @ 1:08 p.m. Defendant John A. Worden in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM6 -  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant wishes to have counsel but does not qualify for SPD services. DE cannot afford counsel at this time. Defendant will speak with ADA Anderson regarding possible resolution. Recess for the parties to talk. 

Case re-called @ 1:28 p.m. The parties have reached an agreement.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: 15CM6 - NC. 15CM8: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CM8: Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. Ct 3 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Statement by DE. Court orders: 15CM6 - Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 15CM8 - 37 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: 5 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than March 15, 2015, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, $350 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, 15 mo DL rev/ 15 mo IID, OWI Assessment. Appeal rights given.
Status conference on February 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on February 2, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 12:51 p.m. Defendant John A. Worden in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Steven P. Smits.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not qualify for SPD if released from custody. Defendant will be privately retaining an attorney. ADA Anderson requesting high signature bond or low cash bond. Atty Smits requesting signature bond. Court orders $3500 Sig Bond. NGP entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
